voice_info.appearance: You see Abel.
sample_lines: You are not supposed to be here.
Oh, yeah? Your momma!
I'm gonna kick yer ass if you say that again!

npc_lines.text: You are not supposed to be here.
Oh, yeah? Your momma!
I'm gonna kick yer ass if you say that again!
You human. Me mutant. Mutant kill human.
Children are not allowed here. This mutant place. Go away.

voice_info.appearance: You see an aged woman.
sample_lines: It is a terrible thing when our youth are threatened. The loss of Tandi would be a terrible thing.
Aradesh loves his daughter very much. It is that love that makes him the man that he is and a pillar of this community. Without that love he would be lost, and Shady Sands would surely follow . . .
I feel that she is imprisoned. She was the target of hatred. That hate is very strong to the southeast. I'm sure you will find her there. Good luck.

npc_lines.text: It is a terrible thing when our youth are threatened. The loss of Tandi would be a terrible thing.
Aradesh loves his daughter very much. It is that love that makes him the man that he is and a pillar of this community. Without that love he would be lost, and Shady Sands would surely follow . . .
I feel that she is imprisoned. She was the target of hatred. That hate is very strong to the southeast. I'm sure you will find her there. Good luck.
Hello. You must be the stranger everyone is talking about. [Agatha sighs.] How can I help you?
My name is Agatha. I am the storyteller of Shady Sands. It is my job to keep the history so that we may remember and never forget.
I'm sorry, I'm very tired. Could you please come back later?
Good day, my child. You look well. You remind me of my own baby.
Thank you. Dharma always said that the farmer who plants politeness will walk easy when the season is over.

voice_info.appearance: You see a super mutant. He is guarding the airlock door.
sample_lines: Normals cannot carry weapons here! Halt and identify yourself!
Halt! What is your business here, 'child'.
Your answer does not settle my nerves. Speak quickly and clearly, or I will assume you are here for foul purposes. I assure you that you will not like that...

npc_lines.text: Normals cannot carry weapons here! Halt and identify yourself!
Halt! What is your business here, 'child'.
Your answer does not settle my nerves. Speak quickly and clearly, or I will assume you are here for foul purposes. I assure you that you will not like that...
You may pass, but next time, follow the proper procedure...
You are making a mistake by coming here. Explain yourself or perish...
What kind of foolish bigotry is that, we are 'humanity.' We're just as human as you are.

My name is Kyle. I was born to a mother and a father, like yourself. The Master just oversaw my rebirth. These muscles, this skin, this strength does not make me any less human than you. I do not like all that the Unity stands for, but it is the best chance for peace that we have.

voice_info.appearance: You see: Alex, the night watch Regulator.
sample_lines: Halt! Who goes there?
No strangers are allowed within the walls of Adytum, by order of the mayor.
Look, it is my duty and my honor to serve as the night watch for Adytum, so it is my business. You turn around and leave, or I'll have to get serious.

npc_lines.text: Halt! Who goes there?
No strangers are allowed within the walls of Adytum, by order of the mayor.
Look, it is my duty and my honor to serve as the night watch for Adytum, so it is my business. You turn around and leave, or I'll have to get serious.

voice_info.appearance: You see Mitch of the All-N-One store.
sample_lines: How may I help you today?

npc_lines.text: How may I help you today?

voice_info.appearance: You see Alya, a desert raider.
sample_lines: I am Alya of the Khans. How might I help you today?
We do not attack those of Shady Sands. We are from the same place they are. It is only right that they share with us!
You sound just as wimpy as they are. Look, if they were in any trouble of starvation, then it is their own fault for not planning ahead. Consider what we do a trade in talents.

npc_lines.text: I am Alya of the Khans. How might I help you today?
We do not attack those of Shady Sands. We are from the same place they are. It is only right that they share with us!
You sound just as wimpy as they are. Look, if they were in any trouble of starvation, then it is their own fault for not planning ahead. Consider what we do a trade in talents.
We give them the most important thing possible. We give their dreary lives excitement.

voice_info.appearance: You see Amber, a teacher for the Followers.
sample_lines: Welcome noble traveler. Have you come here to study?
I am skilled in many of the languages and arts. Perhaps you would like to learn one of those?
Ah, we have here a student of life. In a case like this, I can teach you some herbalism, but training takes a while for little result.

npc_lines.text: Welcome noble traveler. Have you come here to study?
I am skilled in many of the languages and arts. Perhaps you would like to learn one of those?
Ah, we have here a student of life. In a case like this, I can teach you some herbalism, but training takes a while for little result.
You need not be rude. Apologize now, or I won't teach you.
Ah, a student of the arts is a rare thing in this world. Perhaps there is hope for you yet. Each song is long in time. Which would you like to hear?
I can teach you the ways of the old bards and minstrels.

voice_info.appearance: You see Andrew, the jail guard.
sample_lines: Can I help you?
I'm Andrew. My job is to guard the jail.
I'm guarding the jail. I make sure that miscreants don't get in or out.

andrew.description: Human male dressed in protective leather clothing

npc_lines.text: Can I help you?
I'm Andrew. My job is to guard the jail.
I'm guarding the jail. I make sure that miscreants don't get in or out.
Someone might leave something to help a prisoner escape. Or someone might get locked inside, and stuck until we could get the keys.

voice_info.appearance: Kalnor, a Junktown guard.
sample_lines: You'd better put that away. Junktown is a friendly place, friend, and we want to keep it that way.
Your weapon, idiot. Killian won't take your arms away, but you'd better damn well keep them in your holster.

You'd better behave, since it's the law, and I enforce the law. Put your weapon away. Don't draw it unless in self-defense and you won't have a problem with us guards. Disobey the law and we will retu

assblow.description: Human male dressed in protective leather clothing

npc_lines.text: You'd better put that away. Junktown is a friendly place, friend, and we want to keep it that way.
Your weapon, idiot. Killian won't take your arms away, but you'd better damn well keep them in your holster.

You'd better behave, since it's the law, and I enforce the law. Put your weapon away. Don't draw it unless in self-defense and you won't have a problem with us guards. Disobey the law and we will return you to the lawless wasteland--dead or alive.
Hey! You! What are you doing sneaking around?
Well, uh, OK. Whatever. Just don't do anything out of line.
Welcome to Junktown. What can I do for you?

What does it look like? I'm a guard, and I'm keeping an eye out for strangers like you. And this place is called Junktown. Hey, don't laugh. I happen to like the name myself. We mostly do trading. Sometimes we trade with those stuck up bastards from Hub. Hey, you're not from the Hub are you?
Then you must know most of the rules. Have a good day. And I am sorry about the bastards part, OK?
Oh, heck. The place for that is Darkwater's. Killian runs it. It's a little to the north. Killian has the best supplies in town.
I'm sorry, the gates are closed for the night. Come back in the morning.

voice_info.appearance: You see Ton.
sample_lines: Why would I want to talk with someone who goes around killing kids? Get out of my face!
I hear you're pretty tough. But tough don't impress Ton. You got something to say or you wanna get it on? Let's do it!
Man, I already talked to you! Take your shit somewhere else!

npc_lines.text: Why would I want to talk with someone who goes around killing kids? Get out of my face!
I hear you're pretty tough. But tough don't impress Ton. You got something to say or you wanna get it on? Let's do it!
Man, I already talked to you! Take your shit somewhere else!
What do you want, you stupid zombie? Get outta my face before I break it.
You wanna talk to Ton? Fine. But if I hear the word "praise," I'll kill you.
Hello, miss. I am Ton, 2,000 pounds of the Master's toughest fighter. I have also been evolved by the FEV into something that you need to check out. Let's get it on, baby.
Check it out somewhere else. Ton don't like your company.

Fine. You want to play it straight? Sometimes killing's necessary. Sometimes I even like it. But I hear you love killing . . . all the time. Every time I've met a psycho, either he dies, or Ton dies. Ton is still here. So why don't you go elsewhere.
Man, I could learn to like you. You're either an incredible asshole, or you got guts. Either way is fine with Ton, as long as you don't jam me up. You want to join up?
To see you suffer. Let's go, hombre, give me what I want.
Fine. Talking's over. Make your move.
Shit! You're dumber than the zombies! Just get out of here!
The Master wants peace, and he wants us to get it for him, so we're going to have fun. Capiche?

It's not healthy to ask the wrong question, compadre. They have all the answers they want you to hear. People who ask the wrong questions, or people who screw up, well, they don't stay around here very long.
I do my job. They like it when I do my job. They like it when street trash and Followers stop breathing. It lets the Nightkin do other things. Don't mess with me . . . it ain't healthy.
What are you doing dressed like a zombie? If you got the 'tude, you gotta let it show!
We don't drink in here. Nightkin don't like it. You better get a few more clues before you talk to Ton again.
You're crazy! I could almost like you, except that I have the feeling that people who hang around you don't live long. Get the hell out of here.
You stand around this for months and you go crazy as them. What do you want from Ton?
I am losing it in this zombie pit, and I don't need you helping me. Get the hell away from me.
That's Morpheus. He stays upstairs, except to give sermons. He don't even do that much anymore. He's smart and he's a winner, and that's all that counts. Go see him for yourself.
You need to go out into the Boneyard, pal. Ain't no slosh in here, and I've looked!
Agree. What can Ton do for you?
Bitch! You don't know what you're missing! Get out!
Life is too short for that. Let me show you why you don't want to wait.
I'm not LITTLE, bitch!
Who believes in that bullshit? They have to program these morons to believe in that stuff anyway.
When we get the word, we go out and kill people. People like the Followers or some of the more dangerous gang types.
Fine. Do what you want. But I'd get out before it becomes unhealthy around here.
You annoying little piece of shit. You're worse than a Junktowner, you coward. Get the hell out.
What else is there to know? I get to eat well, sleep in peace and kill some of the people who used to screw me over. You want something more from life?
Who knows? Who cares? I get to eat well, sleep in peace and kill some of the people who used to screw me over. You want something more from life?
Hmmm, Ton never thought of that. But if they bother me too much, I break their face. Then they stop bothering Ton. What do you want?
Converting? Well, good luck. You'll need it.

These people, these zombies, weren't always like this. I could even stand a few of them. Then they got converted. Some of them came out like this. Some of them didn't come out at all. Ton doesn't like it, but these people pay Ton well.
You talk to Morpheus or to Lasher, or you can bother Ton, and Ton give you more violence than you can handle.
Well baby, what's going on is that there are a lot of zombies chanting, a lot of people dying and the Children are going to take over everything. And there's you and me and nothing else matters!
Unfortunately, this is the worst place on earth to experience what Ton does best. Too many zombies cramp my style. I'll let you know when I think about some place more convenient . . .
You'll find out soon enough what happens upstairs. If you tough, you get through it fine. It happened to Ton, and Ton is just fine!
Uh . . . I didn't say anything. You forget what Ton told you or Ton will make you forget, permanently!
They used to be whiners. But Ton talks too much. You get out of my face.
Fine. You stay low-profile until I give you the word. Then we have fun.

They're cowards. They set ambushes against our patrols. They send spies and saboteurs. They know they can't win a real fight. The Master says we should feel sorry for them, but Ton just want to kill them. Smart man, Ton.
We need discipline, fool! We're soldiers now! We obey orders. Killers die, but soldiers win their battles. We're going to beat the Followers. We're going to beat EVERYONE!
Who the hell knows? Maybe it's just Morpheus pulling the strings. Things are good, and if this dries up, Ton goes somewhere else.
Well, don't get too eager. Even with the Nightkin, it's still tough fighting. But if we play it smart, we get out ahead. That's the only thing Ton cares about.
The conversion isn't easy. You see these people, all these zombies? They used to be like you and me. Ton survived. These people didn't. But why should Ton care about you?
You don't like the way Ton talk? Then Ton kill you!
Ton go through it fine. I . . . uh . . . I . . . uh . . . Ton . . . Ton just fine.
I used to be with the Dead Dog gang. Always hungry, always tired. This place is much better for Ton. Why should I worry about anyone else? Nobody ever worry about me.
You greedy asshole! Get outta here before Ton kills you!
Then get out of here now, before it's too late.

Nothing important as you and me. Unfortunately, this is the worst place on earth to experience what Ton does best. Too many zombies cramp my style. I'll let you know when I think about some place more convenient . . .
Why you manipulative bitch! Nobody screws with Ton like that!

voice_info.appearance: You see Billy.
sample_lines: Hi there.
Why would you want a brahmin? Do you have a caravan? Well, it doesn't matter. I only take care of them. Dan is the one that owns them; he won't sell them though.
Nothing . . . I mean, I'm taking care of the brahmin.

npc_lines.text: Hi there.
Why would you want a brahmin? Do you have a caravan? Well, it doesn't matter. I only take care of them. Dan is the one that owns them; he won't sell them though.
Nothing . . . I mean, I'm taking care of the brahmin.

What's a brahmin? You must be joking. Why they're one of the major food sources and forms of transportation around here. They haul the caravans. Dan says this is a really important job, but it's the Bone.
You're not from around here, are you? I'll give you one tip: Don't get caught stealing!
Dangerous? No, not really. They can give you a really nasty bite, but they're pretty cool. They fart and burp a lot. I don't know why.
Please don't talk to me. Dan is going to yell at me again.  He really gets pissed -  I mean - mad, when I'm not paying attention to what I'm doing.
I AM working hard!
Please don't talk to me, Dan is really mad.
Hello again.

voice_info.appearance: You see Bob, proprietor of Bob's Iguana Bits.
sample_lines: Ok, Ok, I've got your money.
I'm sorry.  I ain't payin' no more.  Do what you want with me.
What are you doing back so soon?  It ain't time for the payment.

npc_lines.text: Ok, Ok, I've got your money.
I'm sorry.  I ain't payin' no more.  Do what you want with me.
What are you doing back so soon?  It ain't time for the payment.
Hey, I don't want any trouble!
Hi!  Welcome to Bob's Iguana Bits, the family eating place.  Can I take your order?
He's a mean son of a bitch.  You don't want to mess with him.  Anything else?
Fine.  What do you want me to pay?
Sure.  We got whole iguana on a stick for twenty bucks, and our prime select pieces for eight bucks.
Never seen any of them around here.  Water Merchants don't need 'em.
Mr. Decker is a distinguished businessman in a less than distinguished business.  Anything else?
What are you talking about?
Nothing.  Sorry to bring it up.  Now is there anything else I can do for you?
Well, he's dead now, and my cash flow has increased because of it.
Wh...what!  Oh, I see, you're joking...
You must be new in town if you're asking me about the Water Merchants.  Water is life, and you don't get much more powerful than life and death.
If there's anything that involves misery and suffering in the Hub, Decker either controls it or wants to control it.  Anything else?
Don't do that!  Fine, I've been using some questionable portions.  But it's not like I'm committing murder.  Doc Morbid's stuff is already dead, isn't it?
Not so loud!  I don't need you saying that all over the Hub...
Wait a minute.  We've got to find a way to reach a mutual understanding!
Fine.  What do you want me to pay?
No way I'm going for that.  I can't afford more than what I'm paying you now.
Terrible business.  Those poor people.  Oh, those poor people.  Losing their lives in such a ghastly way!  Is there anything else I can do for you?  Like feed you, perhaps?

voice_info.appearance: You see the Brotherhood's Doctor.
sample_lines: Hello, how can I help you?
But of course, but it's very costly and time consuming.
Okay, which operation did you want to talk about?

npc_lines.text: Hello, how can I help you?
But of course, but it's very costly and time consuming.
Okay, which operation did you want to talk about?
That's easy to do but there's a long recovery time. It only costs 2000 scripts but takes 3 weeks to heal.
Now that's a difficult operation. It costs 4000 scripts, but the recovery from this operation is only a week.
This one's not that difficult. It takes about a week and will cost 3000 scripts.
This is the most complex and dangerous! It'll take 3 weeks and costs 6000 scripts.
This isn't that tough of an operation but it is very costly and time consuming. It will take 3 weeks and cost 5000 scripts.

Hmmm. If anyone here needs an Intelligence Enhancement, it would be you. In fact, I'll do it for 3000 caps instead of the 6000 you would normally need for the operation. I can't guarantee that it will help you, but I think it would be worth a try. It will also take 3 weeks of recovery time. You probably don't understand this though, do you?
Are you radiated or hurt? I'll help you if I can.
Ok. You're awake. Let's see here. Do you feel any smarter?
It was a success! I was able to increase your IQ to an acceptable level. How does it feel to have half a brain?

voice_info.appearance: You see a stern, young initiate with a book.
sample_lines: Good day. How may I be of assistance?
Master Scribe Vree is on level three, in the computer lab.
General Maxson is usually on level four, in the council chambers.

npc_lines.text: Good day. How may I be of assistance?
Master Scribe Vree is on level three, in the computer lab.
General Maxson is usually on level four, in the council chambers.
Paladin Rhombus spends most of his time on level one, in the supply room.
Is there anything else I can help you with?
Actually, it is a journal that I am keeping. I'm working on a treatise on the social dynamics of the Brotherhood.

Indeed. I've been researching information about our predecessors from before the war and about the societies of the outside world. I think that the Brotherhood comes closest in organization to the Knights Templar of the so-called 'Dark Ages'.

Although the Brotherhood places a high emphasis on hard sciences and applications technology, there has been little in the way of research into the soft sciences, like psychology and sociology. For a well-rounded education, we must apply scientific thought to all endeavors.

I've come to the conclusion that the Brotherhood functions mostly like a pseudo-religious organization. We have the strong military hierarchy, combined with codes of honor passed down from our ancestors. Combine this with our technical skills and I think that there are two paths of development for the Brotherhood: a techno-religious dictatorship or a benevolent research society.

Ultimately we have a command heirarchy, with the Elders at the top. The most influential positions, then, are the Elders and the High Elder. A charismatic High Elder could direct the Brotherhood almost completely. We need to be careful to make sure that we have a leader who is both strong and visionary. Thankfully, I think that General Maxson fits that description.

According to my research, the Knights Templar were a military brotherhood which focused upon the acquisition of wealth and knowledge. Although they had some religious overtones in their structure, their quest for knowledge ultimately made them a secular organization. I think that they would have been a more theocratic organization if they had a greater interest in wealth and power, since the church of that era was primarily involved in control of gold and land.

Well they are...You know don't you...The disease was just the start.  Now they're going to come and take as all.  But you are just like all the rest.  You won't believe me, and you'll be doomed.  You mark my words.   I'LL STILL BE HERE, and ALL OF THIS, INCLUDING YOU, WILL BE TAKEN.  TAKEN. [Greg grasps his head and curls up in a ball, squealing and thrashing about]

Medication...Oh so you're one of them, trying to get me to take my medication again....Well you won't get me to.  I WON'T TAKE IT, NO, I WON'T.  THE VOICES, NO I WON'T, YOU CAN'T MAKE ME. [Greg close his eyes shut and clutches his head frantically, talking with the voices that only he can hear.]

voice_info.appearance: You see an intense young man.
sample_lines: Thank you for helping us clean out the Regulators from Adytum.  Here are is what we can spare to help you further on your travels.

npc_lines.text: Thank you for helping us clean out the Regulators from Adytum.  Here are is what we can spare to help you further on your travels.

voice_info.appearance: You see a teenager.
sample_lines: You! You did it! When I grow up I'm gonna get you! I'm gonna hunt you down and kill you! You killed them all! Aaaaaalllll! [Uncontrolled sobbing].
I heard about you. You run around the Wastes killing kids! Help! Nightkin!
Hello, sir. Do you need a meditation flower?

npc_lines.text: You! You did it! When I grow up I'm gonna get you! I'm gonna hunt you down and kill you! You killed them all! Aaaaaalllll! [Uncontrolled sobbing].
I heard about you. You run around the Wastes killing kids! Help! Nightkin!
Hello, sir. Do you need a meditation flower?
Hello, ma'am. Do you need a meditation flower?
I heard Father Morpheus had a visit from the Master himself. He's real happy right now.
Father Lasher says I have to keep my big mouth shut. He's no fun!
Aw! You're no fun. Maybe I should tell the Nightkin about you!
Are you sure you don't want a flower?
He's my teacher. He says every lash we receive brings us closer to the Master!
Please don't tell him I said anything to you! Please!
Okay I will . . . (sniff) Maybe Father Lasher will be more kind to me after the Master takes over the world.
Soon, or so they tell me. We're going to have peace, and unity and the Holy Flame will be lit. And maybe Father Morpheus won't be quite so loud, either.
Hi. How are you?
Uh, hello.

This is the Cathedral of the Children of the Cathedral. I don't know why they say Cathedral twice. We worship the Master, and we yell a lot about Peace and Unity. It sounds kind of dumb, but the Master's real smart, so I guess it must be okay.
I give out flowers. Every petal is peace, and the stem is unity. Or are the petals unity and the stem peace? Oh no, I don't remember! Do you want one?
I'm okay. At least until Father Lasher's next lesson.

voice_info.appearance: This is Caleb, leader of the Regulators.
sample_lines: Nice enough town. Me an' the Regulators work hard to keep it that way. Anyone in particular you want to know about?
You'll find him in the big building to the southwest. He might be able to put enough sentences together to let you know that we're looking for some help with the Blades.
They've done something to Zimmerman's half witted son. But like I said, go talk to Zimmerman about it.

npc_lines.text: Nice enough town. Me an' the Regulators work hard to keep it that way. Anyone in particular you want to know about?
You'll find him in the big building to the southwest. He might be able to put enough sentences together to let you know that we're looking for some help with the Blades.

voice_info.appearance: You see the caravan leader.
sample_lines: I don't know if you'll understand this, but we leave in two hours or whenever you're ready.
We usually leave two hours after arrival.  There's nothing here we haven't seen before, though, so if you want to leave earlier we're ready whenever you are.
Well, it's quite a bit like the Hub, really.  It has its share of problems: gangs, thugs, thieves, you know... the usual stuff.  All in all, it's my kind of town. [Laughs]

npc_lines.text: I don't know if you'll understand this, but we leave in two hours or whenever you're ready.
We usually leave two hours after arrival.  There's nothing here we haven't seen before, though, so if you want to leave earlier we're ready whenever you are.
Well, it's quite a bit like the Hub, really.  It has its share of problems: gangs, thugs, thieves, you know... the usual stuff.  All in all, it's my kind of town. [Laughs]

This part of the Boneyard is called Adytum.  The Boneyard is basically run by gangs. Kind of a rough area, so watch your step here. Adytum is run by the Regulators.  They're trying to hold this place together in light of all the gang wars. They're understandably suspicious of strangers, so if you haven't spoken to them yet I suggest you do before you start wandering around.

Not much I can tell you about them.  The Brotherhood keeps to themselves for the most part. A lot of people give them a bad rap, but from what I can tell they're good people.  A little fanatical, maybe, but good guys.
Are you ready to go?

voice_info.appearance: You see a shopkeeper.
sample_lines: The Holy Flame does not appreciate thieves and scoundrels in his house of worship.  You will be punished!
I'm sorry the shop is closed.
The Children do not have to deal with your kind.  And you've been causing us a serious problem. I would like you to go away before I have to call in reinforcements.

npc_lines.text: The Holy Flame does not appreciate thieves and scoundrels in his house of worship.  You will be punished!
I'm sorry the shop is closed.
The Children do not have to deal with your kind.  And you've been causing us a serious problem. I would like you to go away before I have to call in reinforcements.
I refuse to deal with those that use weapons to make demands.  We Children have grown beyond the simple use of guns and weapons.
Greetings, my fellow Child.  How can I help you?
I'm sorry. Perhaps we can just make a deal.
Greetings! How can I help you? I do hope that you will take a moment to realize the significance of any future decisions you might make in regards to your soul...
Only trusted members of the Cathedral are allowed to wear the holy purple.
Oh, stuff to pander to the rubes who walk in the door.  Nothing too special. Go ahead, take a look.
We have all sorts of special items to remember your trip to the Cathedral. These memories can't be bought cheaply, you understand.

voice_info.appearance: You see a clerk from the Crimson Caravans.
sample_lines: Hello. Are you looking for a job?
Great. We have space for another guard. Are you interested?
Excellent. We have caravans leaving for: the Boneyard, Junktown, Necropolis and the Brotherhood of Steel. Which would you like to work on?

Meme? Well, get out of here! This is the property of the Children of the Cathedral.
Great. Of all the people I had to stop, I stopped a piece of cannon fodder. What can I do for you?
You want to help me? I doubt that. What do you have?
Vaut. Vaut? What's a vaut?
It is very dangerous here. Big, bad monsters took over this place. We are trying to save what we can before they come back.
Okay. Suit yourself. When they get back here, you can be their dinner.
Uh oh is right. They are nasty. We are trying to make them understand that people and monsters can live together.
Just tell me who you are before I blow off your head.
So, you are a Follower?
I don't remember you. What's the name?
You are in my patrol area. It is my business. Talk or die!
And who are you?
If you are a friend, then prove it.
You kill harmless creatures which are the end result of man's destructive nature and then claim peace?
Funny. I thought I saw some of them out in the street trying to clean up the gangs.
Those losers are now no more.

We are the Children of the Cathedral. We live and work amongst those unfortunates living in the wasteland. If you ever get to the Boneyard, stop by the Cathedral.
We are the healers and teachers of peace. We heal the body to heal the spirit. All we ask is a small donation to pay for our healing supplies.
It is the most holy of ideas. We are working towards ultimate peace in the wasteland. All creatures shall live as one.

voice_info.appearance: You see a Children of the Cathedral technician.
sample_lines: You have no right to be here. What do you want?

This is the birthplace of the superior race! This is the womb from which the armies of god will strike from! From the flesh of the weak comes the next race of man. Those who survive the dip will becom

You will be bound in the holy restraints. We will lower you into a vat of the blood of god, the holiest of holies. The FEV will shape and change you. You will be strong. You become a Nightkin if you a

npc_lines.text: You have no right to be here. What do you want?

This is the birthplace of the superior race! This is the womb from which the armies of god will strike from! From the flesh of the weak comes the next race of man. Those who survive the dip will become the soldiers of god, and with their hands we shall shape the Unity.

You will be bound in the holy restraints. We will lower you into a vat of the blood of god, the holiest of holies. The FEV will shape and change you. You will be strong. You become a Nightkin if you are fortunate and worthy of the honor, else you will die the most painful death possible. Soon, I will be honored. I will become strong. Then I will fear no man.
You will only leave here as part of the Unity, or a lost soul in Hell! [pause] Besides, I sit down here with a bunch of converts. It felt good to get this off my chest.
You killed the Master. The death of the Unity is your fault. You have caused the death of the human race. I hope you feel good about yourself.

voice_info.appearance: You see a dark-skinned man adorned with bright scarves and trinkets.
sample_lines: Hello, stranger. May I be of service?
And what do you think of our town?
I'm called Chuck. Welcome to Adytum. I'm afraid that most of the people here aren't too forthcoming with strangers, though.

npc_lines.text: Hello, stranger. May I be of service?
And what do you think of our town?
I'm called Chuck. Welcome to Adytum. I'm afraid that most of the people here aren't too forthcoming with strangers, though.

We all need something, don't we? And you wouldn't have talked to me if you didn't want something, whether information, conversation, or perhaps guidance. I can tell that you've been through a lot. What do you need?
[Chuck pulls out a set of Tarot cards.] Let me consult the cards. [Chuck shuffles the cards.]

[Chuck pulls out a card with a picture of a man in a lab coat with a computer in one hand, and a card with a man in power armor.] The Heirophant and the Prince of Wands in the south . . . great wisdom and nobility await in a place to the south.
[Chuck pulls out a card with a picture of a man with a vibro-blade and a flag.] The Prince of Swords in the north . . . you must face a powerful foe far to the north.

[Chuck pulls out a card with a picture of a radio tower, and a card with a picture of a man in a suit with a scepter.] The Tower and the Emperor . . . great change awaits by the hands of a powerful leader. Whether that change is death, I cannot tell.
[Chuck pulls out a card with a picture of a man dancing on a nuclear warhead.] The Fool. I cannot help you; you must make your own way in the world.
It works for me. If you don't want to believe then it's not for you.
It is home.
The Regulators make sure of that. The people of Adytum sometimes suffer because of their strict rules.
Since I wish to stay here, I accept the Regulators as part of that which is Adytum. However, I do what I can to lighten their lives.
The Regulators protect their own interests, and I must respect that.

Well, I'm only one person, but help in what way I can. I advise you to fight for what you believe in, but most of all, choose the fights that are worth fighting, and find the times when compromise and hope will win greater victories.
The people of Adytum have much to do in a normal day. They do not want their work to be found wanting at the end of the day.
Thank you. It has been difficult. We lose people to the Deathclaws sometimes, and winters can be hard, especially when the Hub traders don't come. But we are surviving.
They infest an area North-East from here, and can often take the lives of people given the task of trading with the Gun Runners.
Perhaps. I think Adytum will be here. Instead of going to the world, the world must come to us, like you have.
I'm a farmer. I also like to do a little bit of work on the buildings, restoring them and keeping them intact, and sometimes I give advice.

Yes, unfortunately. I think . . . it is a kind of crucible, that by surviving these hard times, we come to rely on each other and to learn the skills we need to survive. I think, eventually, mankind will be better for it.
They will eventually destroy themselves. And the people who will be left will be the ones who work together to survive, like us.
I'm glad that some of the outsiders, like you, feel that way. We need to find ways to work together to build something new. It won't start here; we are too regulated, but it has to start somewhere.
Hello, then. I hope you're doing well.

voice_info.appearance: You see Cindy.
sample_lines: Oh . . . you don't understand me. I guess we really don't have much hope after all. Excuse me while I cry.
I am afraid of what is happening. Someone has been stealing water and now everyone is on edge.
Some people have been accused and fights have broken out over it, but nobody really knows.

npc_lines.text: Oh . . . you don't understand me. I guess we really don't have much hope after all. Excuse me while I cry.
I am afraid of what is happening. Someone has been stealing water and now everyone is on edge.
Some people have been accused and fights have broken out over it, but nobody really knows.

Some people reported that their water had been stolen. They weren't given more water but some friends shared with them. After this everybody got very paranoid and started guarding their water. A few days later someone knocked the guard out in the ration supply area and stole water.
Maybe you can stop whoever is doing this.
I'm scared. I don't know what will happen to us all. Please, don't let us down.

voice_info.appearance: You see a citizen of Shady Sands.
sample_lines: Welcome to Shady Sands, stranger!

npc_lines.text: Welcome to Shady Sands, stranger!

voice_info.appearance: You see Cleo.
sample_lines: What do you want?
Hey! What's happening?
He's the boss. What else is there to know?

npc_lines.text: What do you want?
Hey! What's happening?
He's the boss. What else is there to know?
She's the bosses assistant. Not a bad gal.
If you're lucky, you'll consider yourself one of us by the end of the day. At home, part of the furniture, you know?
We don't discuss Mr. Decker in polite company.
We had nothing to do with that!
A great leader. He's doing everything to screw over the right people and keep the Hub together -- for a small fee, of course.
It's both a job and an adventure. Helping the poor, risking your life, meeting new and interesting blokes. That us, the good guys!

What rumors do you want to hear? The Water Merchants are playing games. Decker's squeezing merchants for more protection. The Children of the Cathedral sacrificed it to their god. The Deathclaw ate it. Rumors ain't worth nothing. The world's full of rumor and suspicion, and empty of truth.  Look for fact, not fiction. But why are you asking? You had friends on the caravan?
Really? Where are you from?

voice_info.appearance: You see a busy cook preparing a meal.
sample_lines: I'm too busy to talk right now. I've got to get this meal ready!

npc_lines.text: I'm too busy to talk right now. I've got to get this meal ready!

The Cougar is always fine.

The Cougar is always fine.

voice_info.appearance: [You are in your room. Do you want to rest here until tomorrow morning?]

sample_lines: Good day.
Hello again.
What can I do for you?

npc_lines.text: Good day.
Hello again.
What can I do for you?
I am called Curtis.
Our village is small, but we support ourselves. Aside from the attacks by raiders and the occasional Rad Scorpion, we have no problems. Aradesh is a good leader.
I am a farmer. We irrigated the desert many years ago. Although the wasteland is harsh, it is possible to grow things with patience and time.
Crop rotation? What's that?

voice_info.appearance: You see Dan.
sample_lines: Why hello there, m'friend and welcome to the Hub. Let me introduce m'self, they call me 'Dan The Brahmin Man!' I wheel and deal with all the merchants around here, offer'n my humble services for a low

Why, I manage the care for perddy much all of the Caravan's wagons and Brahmin in these parts. If they ever need anything for their caravans, I'm the one they talk to. Hell, the Big Three deal with me
Damn, son.  Have ya' been locked up all yer life in a cave or somethin'? The Big Three are the three largest Merchant groups in the world. Well, okay, maybe not the world, but they sure as hell cover

npc_lines.text: Why hello there, m'friend and welcome to the Hub. Let me introduce m'self, they call me 'Dan The Brahmin Man!' I wheel and deal with all the merchants around here, offer'n my humble services for a low, low price. So now, what can I do ya' for.

Why, I manage the care for perddy much all of the Caravan's wagons and Brahmin in these parts. If they ever need anything for their caravans, I'm the one they talk to. Hell, the Big Three deal with me exclusively.

Damn, son.  Have ya' been locked up all yer life in a cave or somethin'? The Big Three are the three largest Merchant groups in the world. Well, okay, maybe not the world, but they sure as hell cover a large portion; 'bout as far as yer eye can see.

Damn, honey.  Have ya' been locked up all yer life in a cave or somethin'? The Big Three are the three largest Merchant groups in the world. Well, okay, maybe not the world, but they sure as hell cover a large portion; 'bout as far as yer eye can see.

Bramin freak? Is that an attempt at insult'n me? I would be a little more polite to the people ya' meet, stranger. I could care less, but this city is filled with all sorts of cutthroats that wouldn't hesitate to slit yer throat if ya look at'm wrong.

Special, no. Lucky, yes; and unless ya want to be unlucky you'll be a little more polite to the people ya' meet. I could care less, but this city is filled with all sorts of cutthroats that wouldn't hesitate to slit yer throat if ya' look at'm wrong.
Well at least I don't have a mutated hind for a face.  Yer mother must have been a brahmin and yer daddy a rat; that's the only way ya' could have come out so damn ugly.  Hell, yer uglier than me!
Yeah right, that's an okay line, but everyone uses it. Yer kiddin' right? Ya' wouldn't lay a hand on poor ol' Dan.
Yeah, a little maybe. You're not too bad, kid. But just remember to keep that mouth of yours under control. I'd hate to see a good mouth go to waste.

Well, I don't have any openings but ya' might wanna check with the Big Three.  There's a job post in the Merchant Market that might be of some help ta ya'. That's where they, and others, get their men.
Well no, not exactly.  I work very closely with most of the smaller merchant groups, though, and I know we're not hiring.
That's none of yer business, stranger.
Why, hello again!  How are ya' doin'?
What now?
Look, that kid was caught stealin'.  The police put'm in my care ta straighten'm out.
Are ya' daft? That's a quick way to rot away in a cell or get exiled without any food, clothing, or weapons.
I may not be the best role model in this damn city, but I'm the only one who cares and is willing ta try to help.  What have ya' done to improve society?
Ya' think killing people solves the real problem?

You disappoint me. You seemed to have a good head on your shoulders. Killing them might get rid of the problem temporarily, but you've got to get at the root of the problem to really make a difference.
Damn straight. Kill'n the person with the disease isn't the best way. You've gotta find the cure because it's bound to surface again.

voice_info.appearance: You see a big, strong, burly man.
sample_lines: Didn't we just meet? Have you come to kill me?
I know fathers aren't supposed to hug their sons, but I love you, dad!
There ain't nothin' like a Dane..

npc_lines.text: Didn't we just meet? Have you come to kill me?
I know fathers aren't supposed to hug their sons, but I love you, dad!
There ain't nothin' like a Dane..
What's your favorite color, friend? Mine is milk!
Mother, did you think they'd drop a bomb?
They did it with grace and such aplomb!
My name is Dane, it is not Tom!
I like Mr. Handy! I want to have sex with his cute little hands . . .
I'm crazy. I've gone crazy. Oh my god, I have gone completely nuts! Think about peace! Think about Unity!
They're watching us even now! Mr. Nightkin! Felix and Timothy! Cats! Dogs! Nightkin!
Shut up! They'll think you're a crazy asshole! You gotta get yourself together!
Lasher! You gotta kill Lasher! Save the kid! Poor little Flower Child. Poor me.
[Singing off-key] Once, I was lost, and now I see! No more baptism now for me!
You know, I once overheard Morpheus shaking his fist at Nightkin. Or did I smell it?
Does anyone know how to fix a toaster?
Of course they do, idiot! It's your head they can't fix, you son of a bitch!
It's the guns, you asshole! Gunpowder is intelligent and evil and controls your brain! The more gunpowder that's near you, the crazier you become! BOOM! BOOM! BOOM!
You wanna rassle? I used to be real good at it . . . until the Nightkin beat me. Took two of them, though. Nightkin are real strong!
They're mutants, you fool! Of course they're strong!
Don't I know you from somewhere? Does your brain hurt, too?
Of course you know him, Dane, you idiot! He's our enemy! He must be destroyed!
Don't mind him, he's an asshole. I love you. Do you love me?
Aren't you tired of talking with me? Hasn't this just been incredibly tedious?
Aren't you tired of talking with yourself, you schizo bastard?
I hate myself. I want to die, but you're counting on me. Counting on me to say something that makes all of my bullshit mean something! Something important!
MOOOOOO! MOOOOOOO! MOOOOOOOOO! MOOOOOOO!
MOOOOOO! MOOOOOOO! MOOOOOOOOO! MOOOOOOO!
MOOOOOO! MOOOOOOO! MOOOOOOOOO! MOOOOOOO!
Enough with the brahmin! You'll start smelling like them! Then everyone will just puke!
I used to be insane, you know, until I went through the Servitor process. I used to be insane, but now I'm just in pieces. Pieces! Pieces!
I can't believe someone's still talking with me . . .
It's all a game, you see. A game, and I'm one of the pieces. And a kid got real angry, and so he started stepping on me. Step and step and step and step, and finally I just broke!
Maybe they'll scoop out my brain! Scoop out my brain and turn me into their pet! Here, Dane! Catch the ball, Dane! Sic 'em, Dane! Sic 'em, Dane! Sic 'em, Dane! Execute them, you brain-dead dog!
Life sucks, but death sucks worse, and we can't go back in time to stop our birth, so what's the point?
I think they get the point, asshole! They know the Servitor process screws you! They know this 'baptism machine' just messes . . .
My name is Dane. I am a Viking. I like ducks. I rape and pillage! Will you rape and pillage with me?
Oh God! Master, not God! At least I remember my own name. At least I still have that. Most of the other failures didn't, before they shot them. Not pretty corpses either. Nightkin target practice!
I think I'll call my first child Fallout. I had a son once, but the radiation ate him in his mommy's womb.
Asshole! You just laughed! You didn't give a shit about him or his mother before!
Mutants can't breed. And we're all going to become mutants! Don't you know what that means! The world will be sterile! Sterile! Sterile! We won't breed! We'll all die!
Master! I shouldn't have said anything. I heard the Nightkin crying and I felt sorry for it.
What is evil? Evil is when good gets completely screwed up! Evil is when brave people can't be brave anymore! Evil is an anagram of vile! There's got to be a moral standard somewhere!
You know, I used to think religion was a noble calling, and maybe it is; but you can't walk into it blindly, or they'll take control of your brain.
. . . zombies are a disgrace to God, you know.
But why does God make people who break so easily?
I think I can finally answer some questions now. Sorry it took so long.
This is the baptismal. They make Servitors here. When acolytes have been indoctrinated, they bring them here and they go through the process. A few of them survive . . .

Most lose their minds, but they're still useful. They throw them downstairs, rant at them about the Master and walk around in a stupor. You've seen the zombies. Great slave labor -- and soldiers . . .
John Brown's body is molderin' in the Grave. John Brown's body is molderin' in the Grave, John Brown's body is a-molderin' in the Grave, and the Master's screwing us overrrrr . . .
Stop that. It's getting real difficult to hold myself together.
They're mutants. I've heard them talk. I'm very sneaky. I know all their secrets. They hate me. Hate me very much.
I'm screwed, but this is only Phase 1 of the Cathedral Screwover Plan. When servitors get completely brainwashed, they got to Phase 2. That's when the Master baptizes them in the FEV-2!
Most die right there. But those who survive become mutants. BIG mutants. Nightkin! The Master thinks that only the Nightkin can survive. He wants to make everyone Nightkin because they're tough!
You know all this peace and unity bullshit? It really isn't bullshit to the Master. He really thinks that he's saving the world!
Sterile! We're all going to be hideous, sterile freaks! Sterile! Sterile! Sterile! My name's not Errol! Sterile!
The end of the world as we know it. Mutant armies in the Vault, don't blame me, it's the Master's fault. When we have Unity, that's when the Master's fun REALLY begins.
Dumped me in chemicals, filled me full of holes, played loud noises for me. That sort of shit. Tried to make me into something I'm not. Parents do that all the time.
I hurt real bad.
You know, the Nightkin say he's uglier than they are.That means he must be one hideous son of a bitch.
He's the Man! The Man with the Plan!He plans because he loves us! And if the world getsin his way, screw it! Because that's what love is allabout!
Where is your conscience, man? Do you think that life's supposed to be some pretty picture without any misery in it? Life IS misery! Misery, and whatever the Hell we decide to do about it!
Coping! Loving! Screwing! Hating! Taking chances! Boring people! Bashing assholes! Making friends with other assholes! Running away from your mistakes! Facing your mistakes! Radiation!
Having kids and doing the same thing over again, sometimes better, sometimes worse!

voice_info.appearance: You see Darrel.
sample_lines: Greetings, and welcome to the Brotherhood of Steel.
[Laughs at you] Friend, I don't think you have a chance of getting in here. The Elders have a minimum IQ requirement for new Initiates.
Yes..a..well..a..No. It's just people don't even try to understand what we're all about.

npc_lines.text: Greetings, and welcome to the Brotherhood of Steel.
[Laughs at you] Friend, I don't think you have a chance of getting in here. The Elders have a minimum IQ requirement for new Initiates.
Yes..a..well..a..No. It's just people don't even try to understand what we're all about.
The Brotherhood is a collective of men and women who have dedicated their lives to the preservation of technology.
No...I never even heard of one of those. One of our head scribes may know. Maybe you can ask one of them. That is if you join us.
Sacrifice puppies!!! Where the hell did you hear that one? Don't believe everything you hear in the wastes they're all a bunch of pathetic lunatics.
The only way to know anything more about us, is to join us. My friend Cabbot can help you with that.
You'll need to speak with Cabbot about that.
That's OK...It's just people don't even try to understand what we're all about.
Technology. That is all that any one needs to understand. Join us and you will come to know this.
This is Powered Combat Infantry Armor model T-51b or more commonly know as Power Armor.
The Brotherhood are the sole bearers of the Power Armor in the wastes. Only the honored, and Knights of the highest Stature are given the privilege to wear the ultimate armor.

Heathens have tried and failed to take our Power Armor from us. They would have to kill a Brother to possess his birthright, and if it comes to that, the armor would be in such poor condition as to render it useless.

Cumbersome? Not in the least. The sacred armor is so finely constructed to such exacting specifications that it feels like an extension of the blessed one's own body. It increases one's strength many times over and helps you resist the effects of radiation so that you may more effectively serve the brotherhood. I would feel diminished without my holy armor.
So you took the Famous Glow Quest. (Laughs)
Glow, Ancient Order it's the same thing. It's still not a good place to visit.

The Glow, as it is known to topsiders, was supposedly a place where some of the most advanced weapons of that time were developed. At least that's what it says in the ancient writings. Now as fasr as any of us can tell it's a big crater filled with Rads. I think the Elders send Brotherhood wanabes down there just to get rid of them.

Well? To start it's a good 18 days travel to the Southeast from here. And then there's the radiation. There's a reason none of us have ever gone to the "Ancient Order". If you don't have Rad-X you'll be cooked before you even know what hit you.

Most topsiders think that it is just a big Radioactive hole. Thus the name became the Glow or some even call it the Hot Spot. We in the Brotherhood know the truth. According to the ancient writings this place was the source of all our technology. And who knows what may still be there.
Others have tried. We never heard from them again.
The Glow and the Ancient Order are one in the same.

Don't get me wrong the Brotherhood is a great place to join. It's by far the safest place to live in the wastes. No place else will you find better weapons and armor. We serve technology and technology serves us.

Most topsiders think that it is just a big Radioactive hole. Thus the name became the Glow or some even call it the Hot Spot. We in the Brotherhood know the truth. According to the ancient writings this place was the source of all our technology. And who knows what may still be there.
Can I help you?
Sure ask away.

Yes, Rutger came here personally not too long ago, and that's not like him. He was trying to find out what had been happening to his caravans. I've no idea what it could have been. A few others say they saw something over near the hub, but it disappeared before they could get close enough. It's all very unnerving, I hope it's resolved soon.

Not really, but I suspect it's foul play... but then again, there are a lot of strange and dangerous creatures out there in the wastelands. It could simply be some creature, or more likely a herd or band of them. I hope that helps. Good day.
If you were lookin' to get a hold of some better arms, maybe you should try the Glow down south. [Darrel points south]
Here take some Rad-X. [Darrel gives you some pills]
Swallow these like this. [Darrel motions taking the pills and rubs his tummy]. Mmmmm yummm.
Wait, wait, Not yet! [Darrel stops you from taking the pills] Wait until you get to the Glow.

voice_info.appearance: You see a dying mutant.
sample_lines: It was so fast... My brothers were gone... Could not help...
I, I'm... I can't remember... Was the leader of... It... Maybe my holodisk... [The mutant weakly hands you a bloody Holodisk]
We... We were scouting for primes... Came from... From the northwest.

npc_lines.text: It was so fast... My brothers were gone... Could not help...

Bullets flying everywhere, whippin' by your head, blowin' your enemy in two, seein' the fear in their eyes! Ahhhh, that's the life! You look like the kind of person that could serve us well, and we pay well!  Oh yes, we do! We've just had a few new openin's, if you are interested; but of course you are, right?!

We pay 600 hub bucks a job! That's each way! Hell, people say we take all the dangerous routes but I say they're the most excitin'! You need a little excitement in your life, am I right? Of course I am!
What, are you afraid of loud noises or somethin'?
Of course it's dangerous -- why else would I fork out 600 bucks?
A water chip? Hmmm, haven't heard of one of those before. You might want to check with one of the shops outside -- they have lots of stuff. So, did you want a job?
Not much, I've only lost two. I really have no idea why they're hittin' the Far Go Traders more then anyone else.
Who ever is doin' this has got to have one hell of a raidin' party. Our caravans are well armed and you would think that someone would have gotten away by now. They don't leave a trace.
Hell, we go to more dangerous places than they do and our cargo is better!
Well, okay -- maybe it's not better but we do carry a larger variety than them.
Sorry, but we're paid good money to be sure the job gets done! We'll only hire the best! We've got to have reliable men and women on those caravans!
Hell, I don't hire dirty chem cravers! If you want a job you better sober up!
So? Do you want a job or what? I'm offerin' you a great chance at some excitement and lots of cash! You can never have too much of either!
Hey, you did a fine job on that last caravan -- good goin'! Did you need somethin'?
We're not hiring, so what do you want?
Well, you should be talking to my daughter, Keri; she takes care of all that!  She's in the next room.
Yes, she's my pride and joy! Isn't she beautiful? Just talk to her when you want another job. Some day . . . hopefully soon, I'll be able to retire and she'll take over for me.
You dare insult someone's family? I should rip your heart out!
Is that your poor attempt at a threat?
Well I've got to admit, I've heard better.
Well, what are you waiting for? There are caravans to run!

It was the 'pet' of a traveler. When the traveler died, this damn dog just plopped its furry ass down on my doorstep and wouldn't leave. It's been there for days.
So, Gizmo had a couple of boys beat him up and throw him from the casino roof. The traveler broke his damnfool neck and died. The dog was pissed.

npc_lines.text: I am Diana. How might I help you today?

You are that new friend of Garl's, are you not? What do you want?

voice_info.appearance: [More]
sample_lines: What do you want?! Will you assholes never learn? I'm tired of using my talents on losers. Shoot straight next time! Don't let them shoot you.
Incompetent son of a bitch! You need healing AGAIN! I hope they kill you next time!
What is your problem, asshole? Maybe I put you to sleep, shithead!

npc_lines.text: What do you want?! Will you assholes never learn? I'm tired of using my talents on losers. Shoot straight next time! Don't let them shoot you.
Incompetent son of a bitch! You need healing AGAIN! I hope they kill you next time!
What is your problem, asshole? Maybe I put you to sleep, shithead!
The Cause is not helped by morons! Why are you bothering me? I'm a very busy doctor, asshole! You need me or not?
I am not a library! You go outside for answers! Get out now!
Fine! It's always patch you up! Fix you up! Asshole!
I hear they say very bad things about you . . .
This should do it . . .
Go to hell! You wanna get fixed or you just wanna be an asshole?
You loser! Why don't you just crawl out into the Glow and lick puddles? Stupid drunken craving asshole!
And maybe you need a doctor one day and the doctor won't be there. Psycho asshole! You wanna get fixed? Maybe I do something about shit in your brains, too!
You stupid jackass! You're too stupid to feel pain. You remind me of a lower lifeform!
This will hurt a lot!
You are an idiot! Quality, not quantity! You think the Nightkin care when they're outnumbered? Go cry to your mother, you little baby! Now, do you want to get better or not?
Be quiet or I'll take out your vocal cords! Debark you like dog! Ha ha ha! Now you wanna get well or not?
I'm a doctor, not a cheerleader! You need healing or not?
I'm shaking, asshole! Now, you wanna get well or not?
Nightkin prefer to do that. I give them chems sometimes. Nobody pays attention to Doctor Wu. They're all assholes! Now, you wanna get fixed up?
Idiot! Cathedral very busy! Unity keeps Doctor Wu very busy! Now, you wanna get fixed up?
Now comes the fun part!
This should do it . . .
Asshole! Shithead! I'm very busy, and you have to bother me! Screw you! Get out of here, you puke! Now!
You are healthy as a brahmin, but not as bright! Get out of here, you hypochondriac asshole!
You have taken some wounds. I can fix that, dickhead, if you stay very still!
Fine. But I hope I perform an autopsy on you by the end of the day!
Fine, I heal you!
Then leave, asshole! I'll be laughing at your corpse real soon.
You little asshole! Who do you think you are to bother Dr. Wu? Stupid shithead!
You have taken some wounds. I can fix that, dickhead, if you stay very still!
Five broken bones at least, and you've lost lots of blood. Being an idiot is hazardous to your health! You want to get fixed?

Seems like we let in a fool. Well, if you want to get into their place, there is a slight break in their moat. Look for it and run like mad. You may even make it across.

That is a shame. Please leave.

You want to be a Blade? Good luck. But, if you can find Razor, talk to her about that. Maybe she'll let you get jumped in.
Simple. You'll have to kill someone to get in here. She will tell you who you're gonna need to kill.
Simple. Slaughter our enemies, then we will give Adytum a break.
The Rippers. Those Gun Runners are just a pain, but nothing important. They are a  bunch of soft-sellers, anyway.

voice_info.appearance: You see a weary fisherman.
sample_lines: Howdy sir. I don't often see strangers in this spot. Is there something I can do for you?
Howdy ma'am. I don't often see strangers in this spot. Is there something I can do for you?
Wait a minute, aren't you that fella who wanders the wastes and kicks the monsters' butts? Can I help you?

npc_lines.text: Howdy sir. I don't often see strangers in this spot. Is there something I can do for you?
Howdy ma'am. I don't often see strangers in this spot. Is there something I can do for you?
Wait a minute, aren't you that fella who wanders the wastes and kicks the monsters' butts? Can I help you?
What a minute, aren't you that filly who wanders the wastes and kicks the monsters' butts? Can I help you?
No man's ever called me inhospitable, and I don't want to repeat what women call me, but I am trying to fish and I need absolute quiet to catch the damn things, so please try to keep quiet.
Do I look like a scavenger to you? Well, maybe I do, but that's because I spend a lot of time in the Wastes trying to teach my boy to fish and be a man.
I haven't done any scavenging in six years. Too many Rad Scorpions. A fella could get killed out there with all them varmints running around.
About eight years ago, I sold some chips in Junktown. I don't know what they did. One of them could have been a water chip, though I wouldn't bet on it.
Mutant armies? Not in this spot. Just regular armies would be bad enough, heh heh.

You know there's too much politics in the world. I keep telling my boy that these politicians can't wait to blow up the world again. That's why I'm living off the land, to avoid the politicians! Only way to live.
Now that's rather personal information there. I've killed men for asking less, just ask the boy. But I think you look like an honest person, so I'll let it slide this time.
Well, I've fished this place for the last five years and it keeps getting worse and worse. I think it's Skunk, the three-eyed giant catfish, that keeps scaring everything away from my spot.
But I'm gonna get that fish, just you wait. It's getting personal between us, and only one of us is gonna walk away, believe me. I'm more serious than the Brotherhood of Steel about this.
Now you'll probably kill me, but if I don't stand up to you, I'll be setting a bad example for the boy. See my dilemma? Why don't you just walk away and make it easier for both of us!
Well, I heard about a big Vault way to the East, and reports of a secret Vault somewhere down south. And there may be some chips in Junktown and the Hub. Hope that helps.
Mutant armies? Just plain armies would be bad enough. I heard tell that someone's been harassing the ghouls over in Necropolis, but that was a while ago.
Now that's a personal question. My mother's womb, of course, but that's a little too flip. I don't have a home no more. Me and my boy just wander and try to survive.
I do know where some caches are stored, but that's my secret.
Well, it's kill or be killed - the Law of the Wastes - out here, but I'll tell you what. You keep killing monsters and I'll give you some supplies.
Yeah you are. But what the hell does 'runk' mean? Whatever it is, I hope it's friendly.
Now I'm hurt. Here I go, out of my way to be neighborly, and you accuse me of rambling! Well! I don't offend easy, but you just gone and made me mad enough to nuke someone.
What do you want to talk about?
Fine. Take what you want and get out.

voice_info.appearance: You see a lean and unkempt boy.
sample_lines: Hi. Wha'cha want?
Hi. Aren't you that person who goes around helping people? You must got lots of interesting stories to tell!
Hi there. I see you're not stupid enough to be fishing here. What's up?

npc_lines.text: Hi. Wha'cha want?
Hi. Aren't you that person who goes around helping people? You must got lots of interesting stories to tell!
Hi there. I see you're not stupid enough to be fishing here. What's up?
Not sure. Dad and I have been wandering the wastes for so long. We had a friend, a scorpion hunter with us, but he went nuts and we had to kill him, and then we . . .
Hmmm, maybe I shouldn't talk about that.
It sucks. Sorry, I shouldn't use the word 'suck.' Dad thinks that people who say suck all the time are either brain-dead simpletons or inarticulate losers. Dad's always trying to sound smart.
I saw a big thing like a giant spider with two heads, and one head looked human. Dad thinks I sucked up too much radiation. I dunno. Contaminated water does weird stuff to the brain.
Sure!
Yeah. Did you ever hear about the raiders who fell into the Rad Scorpion nest and they all got stung and stung and eaten alive, except for the one who ran away with half his face chewed off!
Well he's kind of loud and boring, and I ain't sure he's my real dad. I think he musta stole me when I was a baby. But he feeds me most of the time, so I like him, I guess.
They're big and they're nasty, and they're getting outta control. Dad said there used to be heroes who'd wander around the wastes and kill them off, but most of them are dead now, I guess.
Big Henry used to go with us, and he was better'n dad and me, until he went insane and tried to strangle me. Dad had to shoot him!
A lot of heroes. The guy who founded the Brotherhood of Steel, Roger Maxim, he was a real good scorpion killer. When I get older, I'm gonna find out where they are and join them!
He's okay, I guess. Actually, I saw him hit a Rad Scorpion between the eyes at seventy yards, but it was a fluke shot.

voice_info.appearance: Watch yourself around the Doc, and I won't have to get medieval on your face.

Hey, this is private property. You'd better be leaving, now.
Don't you know that women are the weaker sex?
Take your puny threats and run home to mamma. You're talking to a real man here.

Do you see to end the evil of the Children?

npc_lines.text: Who travels the halls of the Followers?
OK. I can see that you are a little slow. Who you?
Do you see to end the evil of the Children?
The Children are an occult group who worship some dark god. Personally, I think there is something about them that reeks of evil.
They are a strong lot, but I think with someone of your skills, you will be able to get in and help us destroy them.
If you talk to Nicole, she will be able to tell you more of what can be done to stop them.
Not children. We wouldn't think of harming them. No. These are the Children of the Cathedral. A nasty group of people.
We are the Followers of the Apocalypse. We are trying to bring peace to the wastelands.
We are working to bring about tolerance to those in the wastelands for those few unfortunates who have been mutated by man's destructive nature.
You are right in saying that we, as humans, have been close-minded. However, there is always hope.
A cynic in our midsts. I am sure you have your reasons. Regardless, I am certain we can bring about some type of understanding.
I've heard that the Children have been able to get some of our secrets. I wonder how that is happening?
Truly? I thought as much myself, but feared that I would never have been able to get much support on the theory.
Not really. The only thing I can think of is that the person would have to have access to some information and have access to the outside. You might want to look to the initiates or scouts.
Great job on wasting that agent. Now we might have a chance against those Children.
Would you? That would be wonderful.

sample_lines: Ive been hoping to run into you, child killer. I hope your stay isnt long. Ill be playing close attention to you while youre here. Keep your nose clean in my city, Im just dying for an excuse to
Hello friend, Deputy Tony Fry at your service.

Oh, a newcomer! Welcome to the Hub! You've reached the biggest city on the coast. Heck, maybe the biggest city in the world for all we know. I thought you were part of the caravan, did you come in wit

npc_lines.text: Ive been hoping to run into you, child killer. I hope your stay isnt long. Ill be playing close attention to you while youre here. Keep your nose clean in my city, Im just dying for an excuse to get rid of scum like you.
Hello friend, Deputy Tony Fry at your service.

Oh, a newcomer! Welcome to the Hub! You've reached the biggest city on the coast. Heck, maybe the biggest city in the world for all we know. I thought you were part of the caravan, did you come in with them?

Im not surprised. Most of the new members of our city come in with the caravans, even with the missing caravans weve had. Its a fine city but be careful who you associate with. People like Decker and his thugs can get you into a lot of trouble.

Thats surprising. Its been pretty rough out there, especially with the missing caravans. But youre safe now, just stay away from the Maltese Falcon. They're a bunch of trouble makers, Decker and his crew.
If you say so. So, did you have any other questions?

Its a tragedy really. Some caravans have turned up missing. Butch over at the Far Go Traders is offering a reward for information or something. You should check at the merchant market if youre interested.

He owns the Maltese Falcon in the merchant market, but I wouldnt associate with him if you want to stay out of trouble. Hes nothing but a murdering animal, but the Sheriff wont let me arrest him without proof.
There you are, you thieving little snake! I almost didnt recognize you. Guards!
Hello again. I hope you like our town. A nice young man such as yourself, is always welcome. If you should decide to stay, Im sure you would make a valuable addition to the Hub.
Hello again. I hope you like our town. A lovely lady such as yourself, is always welcome. If you should decide to stay, Im sure you would make a valuable addition to the Hub.
Hello again. What can I do for you?
Yes? I don't have all day. I'm trying to watch the front gate.
Really? I, uh, you should talk to the Sheriff. I cant leave my post right now. Ive got to . . . uh, fend off any raiders that might come. Plus, Im not very good with reports.

Oh, sorry. I hadnt noticed. The Children run the Hospital next to the Water Merchants. Go south past the Merchant market and youll see it just northwest of the Water Merchants. I hope everything goes okay.

Thats hard to miss. Its by far the busiest part of town. The Merchant Market is a few miles south of here. Youll be most interested in the northern section, thats where most of our locals buy and sell to the public.

Why that would be in the Merchant Market, a few miles south of here. Two of the caravan houses are located there, the third is further south. Id recommend the Far Go Traders. They pay well and they're not too crazy.
Water Chip? Well, I've never heard of one. If it has to do with water, though, you should talk to the Water Merchants. Their headquarters are located further south, past the Downtown area.

voice_info.appearance: You see a large well armed man.
sample_lines: It's not often that we get visitors, how can I help you?
This place isn't very accessible with a nest of those damn Deathclaws right outside our factory.
We've gone over there and taken out a few, but they always seem to come back. Besides, we're machinists, not fighters.

npc_lines.text: It's not often that we get visitors, how can I help you?
This place isn't very accessible with a nest of those damn Deathclaws right outside our factory.
We've gone over there and taken out a few, but they always seem to come back. Besides, we're machinists, not fighters.
We manufacture weapons and ammunition.  We've been at this for the last 30 years.  But the last 10 have been hell.
We've stripped the area surrounding our factory of all the scrap metals that were left after the war.  Now we have to rely on Adytum to supply us with raw materials.

At first it was fine.  They supplied us with raw materials, we manufactured and sold the weapons.  Then 3 years ago Zimmerman hired some mercenaries to help  protect Adytum from the deathclaw and the odd random attack by raiders.  Those Regulators are cold hearted bastards and are squeezing us for all we have.  We make the guns and they get rich off of it.
We would if we could.  But moving is a major undertaking with all the lathes and mills.  These are things that aren't just picked up easily moved.  We could move but the deathclaw make it impossible.
If you could get rid of the Deathclaws once and for all you could name your price.
If you clean out that area we'll be leaving, but we'll leave behind more weapons and ammunition than you could possibly use.
You clear out the Deathclaws, all of them, and you got yourself a deal.
Hello again.

We need to be sure.  We've killed over 20 in the past 2 years and they always seem to come back.  And we could never figure out how.  Let's give it a few days and if they are still gone we'll see what we can do for ya'.
Let us know when you've taken care of the Deathclaws.
I know, tell me about it.
It's not often that we get visitors, can I help you?
This place isn't very accessible, with a nest of those damn Deathclaw right outside our factory.

We would if we could.  But moving is a major under taking with all the lathes and mills.  These are things that aren't just picked up and easily moved.  We could move but the Deathclaw make it impossible.
You got it- just take whatever you want. We're pulling out of here in a day or two, but we'll leave more weapons and ammo than you could carry right now. Just come back here whenever you need them.
How goes it, my friend?
How goes it, my friend?
You what?!  You've killed them all? Thank the gods! Now we can move to where we can get our own materials and not have to rely on those snakes in Adytum.  You name it and you've got it, my friend.
You what?!  You've killed them all? Thank the gods! Now we can move to where we can get our own materials and not have to rely on those snakes in Adytum.  You name it and you've got it, my friend.
You got it.  Let your friends know that they got their weapons.
You got it.  Let your friends know that they got their weapons.
Thank you my friend.
Thank you my friend.
There's no reason to leave now that your friends have gotten rid of those damn regulators.
There's no reason to leave now that your friends have gotten rid of those damn regulators.
Welcome, friend. What can I help you with?
Welcome, friend. What can I help you with?

I'm supposed to make sure no one goes by. Dis is Zombie house.
Not a what . . . A WHO. We are the Zombies. If we do good, Set'll make us one of his guards. Now that's all I'm gonna tell you.
You crazy. What do you think dis is? You better leave.
I don't think so. Get out before I call the boyz over and dance on your face.

npc_lines.text: I killed you!

Don't tell me what I should have done, father. I rule the Khans now, and you are but worm meat.
I can see you standing before me, but I don't believe it. What do you want?
What do you want?
Hmmm. Well, then. What do you offer for her release?
What do you want now?
You are barely tolerated by us. Why should we give one of our most prized possessions to you?
Right?! I determine what is right around here. You are treading on dangerous ground.
Would you be willing to fight me over her?
Fine. We shall settle this with no weapons. Knock me out, and I'll let you take the woman and leave. I knock you out, you leave without her.
This will be interesting, but not very sporting. Very well, let's do it.
What do you want?
You? Want to join us? Whatever for?
The Raiders only accept the meanest and toughest SOBs around. You have to be bloodthirsty, violent, extreme. I don't think you can handle that. Can you?
I grow tired of these women. Kill them.
What do you want now?

Oh, if only I were so fortunate! Perhaps one day the Master will let me kiss his body parts. Praise the Master! Praise the Holy Flame!
Hmm, that's not what I had in mind. You had better practice, my friend. Praise to the Master! Praise the Holy Flame!

This is our land, and here, your business is our business. I repeat, state your business.
We found a wrecked caravan about a day's journey to the west. We found one survivor - poor girl. She claimed they were attacked by mutant humans with incredible strength.

The super mutants attacked. We were slaughtered. They had guns and bombs, even some steam trucks. They killed my friends. The mutants just butchered us, like you're probably gonna do to me.
The super mutants attacked. We were slaughtered. They had guns and bombs, even some steam trucks. They killed my friends. The mutants just butchered us.
I don't know.
I heard they was pissed that some human killed their men here.
No.
I heard some of the sewer ghouls might have survived, but I don't like it down there.
Yeah, that's it.
I hid until most of the mutants left.
Some big thing that moved on wheels but without any brahmin.
Hey, then why did you ask about it?
You again? What do you want now?
Nope. Well, I did hear that more super mutants were coming. I don't know when.

There is only peace and joining . . . the price . . . the pain . . . one must be blind . . . nulled.
I will anoint you . . . I must give what I must not.
You cannot kill the genius of . . . the all . . .  you . . . hehf!
Those who have gone before . . . must stop your journey.

I know you . . . right?
Um . . . okay.

I know you . . . right?
